item.title: Introduction to Algorithms(Asymptotic Analysis)-Part 3
item.author: arjitsharma32@gmail.com (Arjit Sharma)
item.description: Practise problems on Asymptotic Analysis Finding complexity of code Statements : Statements have constant complexity. if(n>0){ # c1 printf("Something"); # c2 }else{ # c3 printf("Something else"); # c4 } $T(n)=c1+c2+c3+c4=O(c)=O(1)$ Loops : Check number of times the loop is running for(i=1;i≤n;++i){ //Statment; # c1 } $T(n)=c1*n = O(n) $ Nested Loops : Look at how many times each loop execute and multiply them.
item.dc:creator: Arjit Sharma

item.title: Introduction to Algorithms(Asymptotic Analysis)-Part 2
item.author: arjitsharma32@gmail.com (Arjit Sharma)
item.description: Time complexity of Divide and Conquer Algorithms - These algorithm divide problem in subparts recursively & each subproblems takes additional work to compute the subproblem. Ex- T(n) = 2T(n/2) + O(n), here each problem is div in 2 parts of size n/2 each and it takes O(n) time for each subproblem. Such algorithms can be expressed in form of recursive equation as shown above and there exists a "Master Theorem" to simplify calculating worst case time complexity for such algorithms.
item.dc:creator: Arjit Sharma

item.title: Introduction to Algorithms(Asymptotic Analysis)-Part 1
item.author: arjitsharma32@gmail.com (Arjit Sharma)
item.description: Inroduction to Data Structures - A programming language has data types → int,float,double etc which reduces the coding effort Data Types are of 2 types : Primitive Datatypes → System defined types ex- int,float,array etc User Defined Datatypes → User defined types. ex - structures in C,classes in java What are Data Structures ? A way of sorting and organizing data in computer so that it can be used efficiently in order to solve certain problems.
item.dc:creator: Arjit Sharma
